title: Support champions are nerfed too hard with 8.2
body: Riot really messed up with the changes they made to support items. The fact that there is no sightstone or upgraded support items (i.e. face of the mountain) leaves tanky supports, even other supports in general, close to useless. A primary job for a support is to ward the map and control vision. It takes about 10 minutes to even get an item that will allow you to ward and a ton of your gold in order to do so. There needs to be some kind of compensation for these changes or support players will be left feeling useless until changes are made. Ask any support main how they feel right now and they will tell you that these changes are not just different they are for the worse.

Tank items on support is one of the most useless items you can buy.. 
1. No one actually focus support in the team fights, unless you are soraka or maybe sona. 
2. As support you need to have as much items as possible to aid your team, not only one champion. 
3.  Top laner is usually a tanky part of your team.. 
4. Tank items for support is usually benefitial only on early stages of the game. it helps you stand in the lane if your ADC is noob.  

Support needs to concentrate on speed and active skills items most of the time. Because speed and ability to support your whole team is the key elements of this game, starting with providing vision to your team and about sustain in a team fights, so {{item:3107}}  and {{item:3306}} were one of the key supporting items.. Now only {{item:3107}} left and since there is no way to decrease CDR of this item anymore it is not so useful anymore.. 

The rune tree is also crap.. As support you cant have items CDR, hexaflash and ult cooldowns in the same rune tree. You need to sacrifice one thing over another - not to mention that demolition is also good. 

From my perspective this downgrade effected atleast ~30% of a support game play if not more...
Spending 800 gold on Sightstone always felt like garbage to me. This is one of the better changes I've seen in this game, alongside the Sona nerf partial revert.

Let's face fact: the reason Rito removed Sightstone from the game and made it evolve out of support items is because they're tired of routinely punishing bronze players every day, that got reported for refusing to buy Sightstone. (Yes, Rito had publicly stated multiple times that not buying Sightstone on support is a punishable offense.)

Well guess what: they didn't fix the problem AT ALL.  I still had a support who openly and LOUDLY refused to upgrade their support item for the sole and intentional purpose of not having it evolve into Sightstone.  Matter of fact, halfway through the game they just straight-up sold it, gimping their residual gold-gain as well.  Sightstone is a FREE evolution out of an item that you WANT to buy on support and players are still INTENTIONALLY refusing to buy Sightstone even after Rito made it FREE.

That aside, let's not forget the old adage: you can lead a support to wards, but you can't make them ward.  Rito can hand supports a free Sightstone, but they can't make them use it.  FFS, we can't even get people to use their damned free yellow trinkets, they spend all game sitting on 2 free wards and end with a vision score of ZERO.  Did Rito really think it would be any different for supports?  This doesn't even count as a band-aid fix, Rito is just rubbing some spit and dirt on a broken leg and pretending that'll fix it.

Early ganks are not so prominent, usually junglers tend to reach at least lvl 4 before ganking, also they want to have some power behind their attacks so buy at least 1 item before ganking.    
Not to mention the fact, that in early ganks 2v3 is possible to run away quick or actually overpower them, depending on a champions you are facing. in short early ganking is always a risky choice and not many decide to go that way. 
Also it depends on a lanning and how you control the lane. Pushing your lane or winning ~15% creeps is not always an option. You can lose a little creeps but have the enemy team near your turret making them vulnarable to your jungler and increasing your chances of surviving. 
Farming is not the same as controlling the lane..

The overall impact was actually pretty low.

You still get a "sightstone", since your T2 support item upgrades into it after the quest, which doesn't take more than 10 minutes. I didn't realize this initially, which was where most of my gripes with the system came in.

There are four main differences

* You can't get sight stone first back anymore, where before you'd choose between it and your T2 support item plus boots. Annoying for vulnerable supports like Sona, but not horrible.
* You can't get a big support item off your gold gen. That sucks, but the eye always was more slot efficient anyways, so it's not the end of the world.
* You don't have the old quests. This kind of sucks, but quests were a recent addition, so it's not like that's a major usurping of the old.
* You don't go out of your way to buy sighstone anymore. You go from spending 1650 on your T2+Sighstone to only spending 850 on your T2 for essentially the same effect.

Over all, it actually feels nice. You have 800 gold to spend on whatever you want; I feel rich.
